TopicTitle: [1.0.4][Kopernicus]KerbolPlus v.2.3.9 - a planet pack that ads the legendary Gas Planet 2 and more.

Articles.Content: Hehe as soon as I touch again my computer I'll include Module Manager in the download on git.
Added Module Manager the download and updated the OP! We now have a mission album to Sarvin made by a reddit user.

Decided to make a ribbon pack for [FinalFrontier](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/67246) to cover the KerbolPlus planets. Anyone is free to download and use; including if you guys want to package it with the main installaion. CC BY-NC-SA

[https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/22466/KerbolPlus%20Ribbons.zip](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/22466/KerbolPlus%20Ribbons.zip)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-15T12:56:50Z" title="05/15/2015 12:56  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 15, 2015</time> by jfjohnny5**
Owersome! I'll include it in the OP when I get next chance to touch my computer.
is this compatible with OPM?
Nice got it working with OPM and sitting at a 3.3gb Ram usage using ATM and OpenGl

> 
> Impressive , added. When can we expect EVE configs and why don't you merge New Horizons to it ?

Not KillAshley but:

[![screenshot3775_zpsu4qoehpi.png](http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/screenshot3775_zpsu4qoehpi.png)](http://s1383.photobucket.com/user/Yukon0009/media/screenshot3775_zpsu4qoehpi.png.html)

Keelon
nice but it should be a bit faded...

> 
> I already have .dds conversion done, but we still nead to finish some more things like Biomes before next release. EVE configs are also planned, as well as resources that will make (especialy) the Sarvin system feel like it was created by SQUAD.

Well I'm looking forward to that. The memory issues on my install are brutal lol. Even with things like DX11 and ATM. Texture optimization of this pack would greatly help that. Resources and EVE are also going to make this pack even greater.

What I like most about this pack so far (besides the planets) is that you didn't mess with the stock system very much, just expanded on it. I sort of dislike packs that stick Kerbin around Jool or whatever. It just feels weird.
Thanks. I'm now doing a little quick side project of reviving Alternis Kerbol.
Also, try OpenGL to reduce Ram usage a lot and get a smoother play time! You may have problems with HUGE stations trough...
I think I can turn OPM and K+ into a mini RSS of sorts.
Owersome! But you'll nead to no longer use our Gas giant, but only OP's cheers and wish you luck!

> 
> make sure you have 2.6.3 Module Manager.dll installed in your Game Data folder.

You should remind this in some readme or just add it to an archive. I had to read about 8 pages of forums, before I found what I was missing.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-17T21:18:33Z" title="05/17/2015 09:18  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 17, 2015</time> by Dixi**
Well, now module manager is already included in the download. Just install it alongside the other folders in GameData.

Does this do anything to the stock solar power curve, which is now stupidly punishing past Duna (which makes solar power beyond useless for anything this adds)?

If not, do you know how to mod that and can I do it via ModuleManager?
It doesn't do anything with solar curve. I believe it is realistic enough anyway! Use the damn RTGs! After all that's how we're supposed to use them...

Hey man! Remember I made those Moon pack mod things? Well, I kinda want to make them again, but I don't know if KopernicusTech works in 1.0.2. Does it? Cause for you and OuterPlanets mod maker, it looks like it does.

- - - Updated - - -

Also, I know you can make the ground bumpy in the config, but how do get specific mountains?

god it's so difficult to explain all but. First:

This no longer uses Kopernicus Tech, only Pure Kopernicus that is less buggier and simple to work with. In the configs, you can change bumping but large relief forms are only specified by the height and normal textures. For example, we had to play a bit with the height map on Potatus (I. E make thecenter lighter) to give a nice oblate effect. Cheers and We welcome you into the mod comunity. 

Also, do you have a link to those moon packs?

> 
> god it's so difficult to explain all but. First:
> This no longer uses Kopernicus Tech, only Pure Kopernicus that is less buggier and simple to work with. In the configs, you can change bumping but large relief forms are only specified by the height and normal textures. For example, we had to play a bit with the height map on Potatus (I. E make thecenter lighter) to give a nice oblate effect. Cheers and We welcome you into the mod comunity. 
> 
> Also, do you have a link to those moon packs?

Ahh! I see! Ok.

A link? I thought you posted on one? Some excellent tips that I am now using for my next Moon Pack. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Alright, before I fix the download links try this one! 

**DOWNLOAD@Mega**

[https://mega.co.nz/#!E85VRK5J!yCReQJMXj3m1nGpzlwXUorj2RzxFsJJvaV88CkB8gys](https://mega.co.nz/#!E85VRK5J!yCReQJMXj3m1nGpzlwXUorj2RzxFsJJvaV88CkB8gys)

**@amarius1** Everything looks so cool ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Before I move to New Horizons I'd like to expand my current game. Does this pack alter original planets? Can I add it to an existing save?

it keeps all stock planets and in their normal positions too. there are just new bodies all over the place, plenty to look at and explore although it still nedes more tweaks than new horizons, im working on quite a few things right now. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Maybe we should start actually coordinating again the mod on email! ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

BTW, finished .DDS conversion and added Ribbons for the next small 2.0.5 update but I hhaven't had time to upload them and fix the download links... do you still want to do the eve configs or i should let someone else do it? I don't want to put you under pressure too much. Also, turns out Kerbal stuff refuses my files when uploading. I have to sadly delete te mod and make a new page there so we can upload again. Cheers and see you on mail!

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> **@amarius1** Everything looks so cool ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Before I move to New Horizons I'd like to expand my current game. Does this pack alter original planets? Can I add it to an existing save?

 you can safely add it to an existing save as this does not modify stock planets IN ANY WAY. It just fits the gaps wile, in the same time, adding the official bodies SQUAD was working on but never implemented.

Currently, this mod's page is quite confusing... it says that version 2.06 is available, but CKAN says "1.5.5", as does KerbalStuff. There's a warning not to use the GitHub download, and GitHub doesn't have the compiled plugin (but I guess the sourcecode works, and there is version 2.07 there?)... finally, buried deep in the thread, there's this Mega link, which just says "2.0"...
